comments.text:
We were 5 men in that van. Thanks Chris.

Almenaŭ ni estis sen niaj dorsosakoj ĉar ni akiris aŭton por porti ilin ĉiujn al via Airbnb de tiu ebria serbo kiu parolis hispane...
In the dark with around 10 Tramprennen people. Reflective vest on. First car took 3 of our people. 20 Minutes later a van took the rest.

Jablanica-Ostrozac: Sidewalk in the direction of Sarajevo opposite side of I guess apartments. Saw two HHers get picked up so claimed there spot. Waited no longer than 5 minutes and got a ride with a young friendly Bosnian. Plenty of cars headed for Sarajevo.
5 mins back to Mostar
We got ride on the way to Mostar very quickly.

Blagaj-Mostar: Waited not even 20 seconds before a friendly Bosnian dude who happened to be a tour guide picked up me and a Jap traveler. Bus schedule sucks so HH was the way to go. Nice open area for cars to stop.
Great spot towards Buna. The first car picked me up after just one minute! The only downside is there's no shade.
Really good spot. The first car that passed stopped and took me to Buna.
Not so much traffic, but more than enough to get a quick ride to Buna.
A lot of traffic here towards Sarajevo, easy spot to stop
This was a great spot to get to Sarajevo
a chinese couple took us all the way to Sarajevo. we were really lucky. the road is busy and only one heading to Sarajevo from there.
Good spot to go to Bihać.
after the border, to Bihac, easy to find a ride
Very good spot, if you want to get out of Mostar, take this as a kind of gaphitch! For going to ljubinje or trebinje (lovly City). Good rides to y'all!
Got a ride to Blagaj (after Mostar) with a friendly guy

Probably it's the best to go to the end of the city to avoid local traffic. Previous driver left me near that place and it was good. Actually my driver was going to Modrica and the best way is via Zivnica, but he changed route for Sarajevo for me.
I was at bus stop, traffic lights are nonsense for drivers in this place, but really helpful for hitchhikers, cars are going slow. Any place you feel on this road is good.

Facila loko al Blagaj, la freneza histeria maljunulo nin lasis ĉi tie.

Nia lasta veturo en la ludo de tramprennen. Tiu, kiu igis min kaj Chad fini ĉi tiun ludon por atingi la 4-an lokon.

Ni estis kvin restantaj vojaĝantoj el Tramprennen irantaj al Mostar, fakte mi estis en la ombro de arbo kaj, Daniella, unu el la gajnintoj de la teamo "maljunulino kaj kato", kaj ankaŭ nia germana amikino, kiu loĝis en Ĉilio.
3rd Truck of the day
We were lucky that the 2nd car that passed us took all 4 of us.
A lot of cars going not that fast and to Neum
Great spot if you want to go to Mostar

This whole road that goes to Camp Maglic, Camp Outdoor Tara and more up to Prijevor where you can hike to Maglic or Trnovačko lake is extremely easy to hitch. People are very willing to pick you up and there are many tourists around (summer time) Just make sure to not get lost at night here, it gets cold! We stayed here for two days (2 people), thumbing all the time.
Decent spot, which was close to where we slept. some space for cars to pull over. got a ride to Mostar
Loots of space to stop. Got a ride in no time to Rogatica.
HH with sign "Sarajevo". There is a petrol station and some restaurants from where we got a ride.
Ok place to HH, there is a place for cars to stop, however there is no shadow.
Good place to HH. Lots of space for cars and trucks to stop. After short time we got lift to Mostar.

Got here at around 14 pm. Got a ride to Bijeljina after about 30 minutes of waiting. We got a sign to Bibeljina. 
There is a busstop where you can hide from the sun and a lot of place to pull over, cars are not going very fast.

After a failed attempt in Zvornik, I decided to move a bit north. Here there's plenty of traffic, people were acknowledging my presence way more and there's space for cars to stop. Stayed right in front of the cemetery's small entry, with a sign "Sarajevo" which got me directly there
The guys invited us for dinner and beer
There is a bus stop somewhere around there. We got a ride from a lady in the evening and she showed us a place to set up a tent at the lake. Then drove us to Nevesinje in the morning the next day
A spot after the bus stop, also with place to stop for cars and shade from trees:) We git picked up by a guy going to Dubrovnik and he drove us to the center of Mostar
Bagnet spot, not to far from the border and all of the Maine traffic goes there. A german guy have us (2 people) a ride to the center of banja luka

Great spot to get to Montenegro. Can hitch from the petrol station but we found it better to go onto the lay-by on the other side as traffic moves pretty slow so plenty of time for people to read sign.
Right after I started hitchhiking, two soldiers stopped for me. If you're heading towards Trebinje, this is a good spot. There's shade, space for cars to pull over, and a decent amount of traffic.
After exploring Počitelj, I started hitchhiking here and quickly got a ride. Lots of cars stop in this area thanks to the nearby restaurants and bakery.
Good spot direction sarajevo at the entrance of the highway. Not a lot of space to stop but cara go slow. Got a ride from a guy on his way to belgrade in 5 min (solo male hh at 12:30)

I thought this spot would be terrible to find a hitchhike; when I was hiking towards the car road I saw only one car per 5 to 10 minutes, but when I arrived at the road I got a ride from the second car that drove past! I might have been lucky, and would not recommended this spot in terms of weather; there is no shadow or shelter. However, sometimes on smaller roads cars are more willing to take you.

Quite some locals on this road in the direction of Neum and back. No shadow on this spot but when I was walking along the road, I went to a house to ask to fill my bottle and got a hand full of tomatoes from the very sweet lady. The family that picked me up with the car brought me right to the entrance of the train station!
Lot's of people stopped at the gas station so we just asked around. Quite some tourists that were going for longer distances
To kravica entrance
We waited 30 min and some Bosnian from USA took us to a lake ans offer us coffee and cevapi ;)
Some spanish girls took us and change their plan for us until Bihać.

This is a great spot to hitchhike to Zenica! The funniest thing happened here, last year my friends and I also hitchhiked in Bosnia on this route. After visiting Sarajevo we wanted to visit this sweet Bosnian lady we met last year in Vites. At the petrol station we got picked up by this Bosnian guy. After two minutes in the car we both realised that we met eachother last year on the same route. He was so happy to see us again that he bought us a beer :D. Shoutout to the best steel factory worker
Lot of people going to Croatia stop here because its close to border, just ask around in the cafe
I was lucky. The first car stopped and gave me a lift to Kulen Vakuf.

We didn't even have time to finish writing our sign when the guy at the table next to us at the restaurant offered us a ride. 
End goal was Sarajevo which was easy from where he dropped us off.
This was where we got dropped off on the way from Sarajevo to Lukomir. Not many cars in total (but maybe because of national holiday). Ski resorts in summer are weird
Second guy took us to the next village. Goal was lukomir. Don’t be discouraged by there being so few cars. People are nice :)
First car took us.
Plenty of space for cars to pull over along the whole road. Decent amount of traffic as well.
I waited right behind the bridge and quickly got a free ride in a taxi to Mostar.

I stood right behind the Croatian border and got a few people stopping.  I walked there from Metković and got told by a border guard to go a bit behind the border station out of its sight. Rides to at least Mostar should be easy to get, I even got one all the way to Sarajevo.
The spot is great, but the cars not going too far. Or they just did not wanted to pick us up.
Nice place to stop, and cars from Serbia going to Visegrad can see you easily.
Good spot at the bus stop. Waited 15min and got a ride accross the border and further to a good spot (solo male backpacker, sign "Croatia")
Waited 20min and got a short ride further to the border (solo male backpacker, sign "Croatia")
quite a walk from Jajce, but waited just a little
Stood by the petrol station and got picked up within 1 minute in a very nice Mercedes. The guy showed off his speedy car on the beautiful mountain road
Not the busiest road but didn’t wait long to get picked up by 3 construction workers in a van going north
good spot to Mostar
you can hitchhike cars after visiting Una waterfall
There were not many cars passing by, but people here are very kind and helpfull
When I did this spot it was under construction so everybody went really slow.
Waited here for a while with a sign to Banja Luka, had to wait a while due to getting there late but people were super friendly and smiled and waved all the time. Decent spot
Directly got a ride to Herceg Novi at the gas station. It seems to work even at night (10 PM).

We got dropped and picked up all the way to Zagreb at once! Just before sunset as well, so we were extremely lucky. The couple even dropped us at a guesthouse in Zagreb. 
Not sure if it generally is like that, since i did not see a lot of trucks around there
Took a taxi to this petrol station, since it was hard to reach and people warned us Zenica is not a good place to be walking around. When we got there we asked some guys and they took us 40kilometers

English below

Nous arrivons depuis Split et allons à Mostar
Deux personnes (homme et femme)
Passage de frontière facile à pied.
Bon spot à l'ombre
Aucun pb avec la police

We are arriving from Split and going to Mostar
Two people (man and woman)
Easy border crossing on foot.
Good spot in the shade
No pb with the police
Everyone here is going to Tuzla.
Great spot, plenty of space for people to pull over and although not much traffic I think that works on your favour. Beautiful scenery and got a ride to Croatia in a few minutes
Along the road. In 5 minutes I got a ride to Sarajevo (no mistake in the spot direction, it's the faster way).
Perfekt Route to Croatian Border - use the wax to Grude to come to Coast fast
We didn’t even pull out our sign and we already got a car stopping us🤙🏽
Nice spot, many cars going to the highway. It took us (2 guys) 30 minutes to get a ride to Zenica.
Nice car bay, a lot of traffic to take you to the highway
Great spot to go Mostar, little bit of shade and a lot of cars
Great spot to get to mostar. We got a ride right away. Cars are driving slow and theres enough space for them so stop.

Maybe bad luck.
Good place. Drivers coming from town slowly and they can see u from far away. 
But it was end of September, waited there for a carride to Mostar. Then I walked further. After the roundabout I got a HH.
good spot to hitchhike towards mostar. cars can easily stop on roadside.

Still works. I got a ride to the border in 10 minutes with a sign saying “DUBR.”
Some people did ask me for money, though.
Lots of traffic. Stood 200m further down the road with a sign saying DUBR. Got a ride after 5 mins to Dubrovnik. 2 persons, Wednesday around noon in May.
Apparently a good place, but after two hours waiting with a 'Dubro' sign, and half an hour just with my thumb, I gave up :/
Got a free ride to the Croatian border from a taxist in 5 minutes.
Sign "Mostar".

Went to Mostar from here. Even tho it might not look optimal on the map, I did find the spot rather nice. The cars didn’t go to fast, enough space to pull over, and the stretch between the road bends is long enough for the drivers to see you.

A good spot for Belgrade. I was sceptical at first bcs google maps was showing me a different faster route to Belgrade but a local guy told us this is the road people take. We got a sign to Belgrade and got picked up pretty fast. Its near a gas station so a lot of place to pull over
Hitchiked here 5 times, 4 times I catched a ride to Beograd airport, 5th time to Novi Sad
Stood a bit behind the intersection and got a ride to Blagaj after some time.
Most people were going to Blagaj but some guy took us to a better spot where we would have a better chance to go to Foča
Nice spot, the traffic is pretty dense. Got a ride in 20 minutes to Doboj.
Got here randomly, and an older couple took us to doboj!
there is a little space for cars to stop, we got ride a bit towards Croatia

Good spot in shadow, after the streetlights, there's a place for cars to stop for you
(1 male, 1 female)
Very easy to get a ride at the red light. I just wanted to go to Široki, no backpack or sign.
The best place to hitchike from Mostar to Medjugorje. The good thing is that is in shadow so we are protected from the hot Herzegovian sun.
Not many places to hh, it's ok at this traffic light since it's often red. Waited 40min (solo male backpacker, sign "Croatia")
Easy to find someone that goes north to split

Good spot towards the south, lots of traffic and people were friendly. Cars go a bit fast, but there's a bus stop so it's easy for them to pull over. Only downside is there's no shade, and it gets crash hot!
Had a sign saying "Doboj". got a ride pretty fast
Got a lift  towrds the north here after only a few minutes, there's space at the point where the road splits
Good stop to go in direction of Visegrad. We got a ride with Serb, that was going to Kraljevo in Serbia.
Good spot to Višegrad.
Good spot at the and of town with lots of space. Not a whole lot of traffic but good chances of getting a ride to Trebinje.
A guy dropped me here from Medjugorje. Got a ride to Trebinje from here
Really good spot, big bus stop and quite a lot of cars to Rogatica/Sarajevo
Good spot towards Sarajevo (probably to Serbia and Dubrovnik also - on the other side).
Not the best spot, hard to stop around, but we got a ride eventually (couple)
Going to Mostar. Waited a bit long but got a good ride. A couple of hitchhikers that came there too just went on a highway and got picked up quicker. U guess that works too.
Still works. Plenty of traffic and friendly reaction. But we gave up after 2 hours just because we were a group of three... Some cars stopped for us, but they only had space for one person.
Great spot inside the city to go towards Mostar. We took the from the old town and walked 15 minutes to here. Got a ride pretty fast.
Perfekta por mi. Rekte al Sarajevo kun bulgaraj junuloj.
Gave up after an hour and half. Tried with amd without a sign. probably worse than the bus stop which also didn't work for us
Wonderful spot. I Got a ride at 11 am with no problem. Lots of space to stop and people to see you. Hh to sarajevo from mostar is easy and this is a great spot.
Great spot waited 5 min for a ride to jablanica around 11am with no sign only thumb.

It was sunday around 3pm and the traffic was very low, but two Bosnian girls stopped and took us all the way to Doboj, even though they were going somewhere else, they rode 2hrs more just for us! The spot is good 👍 👌 you should stand before the gas station so the cars can stop there and take you. The only con is that 😉 there's no shadow
Asked a guy at the gas station if he would bring us 3kilometer.
Very good spot, waited 30 min solo guy on friday 13 pm
Good spot before a gas station direction Sarajevo, cars drive slowly cause it's going up hill.

Ĉi tiu loko estas bona por Mustar, multaj tramprennen rajdantoj ricevis rektajn veturojn.

Ĉi-tage mi havis kapdoloron, Chad savis nin. Fakte danke al li du aŭtoj haltis. Donante veturojn al ni kaj ankaŭ al TBA kaj T&T, kiuj ricevis belan avantaĝon rilate al tempo, ĉar la 10 minutoj da atendado por veturo tute estis en niaj kontoj. Mi sopiras ilin ĉiujn.
The same guy that brought us there the night before.
Good spot if you wanna go to trebenje but be patient , good traffic but mostly local traffic in winter
Not much traffic and space, but it still worked to Trebinje. You can rest in the shade of an unused building.

An ok spot, people here are going from sarajevo and especially  the A1 highway towards tuzla. There is shade but not a lot of room to pull over. However it is possible to stop a car here. Nonetheless we got a ride with a sweet grandpa after 10 minutes of waiting.
Got dropped here by my ride and took a bus to sarajevo centre. This is a good spot to go towards belgrade, cars coming from the coast pass and  the A1 pass by here
pretty good spot, but bushes and no shadow
just asked smoking many:)
This spot is fine but even in the morning with high traffic people wouldn't want to stop 😑. Finally we got a ride with a rich guy 😎 who took us near the border.
There's a traffic light, I just asked one car and got a ride! 1 minute.
Good spot, probably it's hard to get through border, especially in off-season, but I easily get a ride almost to the border and then I crossed it by foot.

Tre bona poento. Kvankam estas nokto. Tio estis amuza, ĉar ni, Ĉado kaj mi, alvenis ĉi tien ankoraŭ dumtage, sed tiel lacigitaj de la trolado de la limkontrolo, kiu devigis nin marŝi 6 km por nenio krom blablabla, ke ni decidis manĝi en la restoracio, kredante, ke ni ne havus pli da ŝancoj tiun tagon atingi bonan rangon (ni atingis la duan lokon tiun nokton). Sed ni ricevis rektan vojaĝon al Banja Luko.

Tio estis malfrue en la nokto, sed ni havis "Tramprennen" por venki. Ni uzis 6-kilometran ŝildon, sed 2-kilometra ŝildo ankaŭ funkcius, ĉar baldaŭ estas disbranĉiĝo. La ulo ne iris al Kupra, sed proksime, kaj fine kondukis nin tien.

Ni estis grupo da tremprennen-homoj en ĉi tiu benzinstacio. La prioritato estis la teamo TatzeUndGlatze, T&T de Vehiculi captatio ankaŭ estis tie. Do, por ke la afero fluu, mi faris flughavenan ŝildon kaj iun veturigis tiun direkton, sed la ulo estis tre laŭta kaj malfacile komunikebla. Mi suferis pro forta kapdoloro... Li kondukis min kaj Chad al la flanko de la flughaveno, kiun ni deziris, sed preskaŭ kondukis nin laŭ la malĝusta direkto. Ambaŭ teamoj ricevis pli rapidan kaj pli bonan veturon
Se vi volas iri al Serbio, vi pli bone provu unu de ĉi tie, ĉar de Viŝegrado estas diable malfacile. Iafoje ŝajnas, ke neniu laboras ĉe la benzinstacio, sed ili laboras.
Sign "Blagaj".
Hitched a ride while  walking to find a spot. Sign Sarajevo in hand.

Spot is ok. Cars can stop in a bus stop and they can see you. Got a ride from some nice guy who even spoke english. He saw us before and turned around to get us. So maybe not the best spot to bee seen? But seems alright
Quite some cars. But seemed like people didn’t wanted us there. Didn’t take long for a quick ride to the next village
Just right before the toll station. Cars are slow and plenty of place to stop. Not too much traffic.
Two teams of 2025 tramprennen got quite rides despite the low quantitie of cars. (Roadkill Gourmet+ Tatze und Glatze)
Good place to catch a ride to Tuzla, traffic is slow and many cars returning from Serbia are passing there
Bro took us to Trávník, nice dude is took us a bit longer but no problem.
pretty decent. got a ride despite the shitty trafic,but he only drove us across the border and dropped us off behind a toll booth on croatian side. spot is unfortunately illegal though

Here we got picked up after like ten minutes with four people. This ambulance driver took us in his car which was lowkey broken. the backseat of my spot was gone and there was a big wooden stick on coming from the back of the car but we figured it out. After 5 min he stopped at his house and his 15 yo son took us the rest of the way to another road. Super funny guy he laughed all the way through.
3 people hitchhiking. Usually we get picked up a lot faster in Bosnia. Eventually got a ride from a very friendly local who didn't even need to go anywhere, just liked to drive!
We walk hitchhiking then a german van took us to Blajag then we met the same van to Mostar, lucky one
Bosnian girl give us a ride to the road before kravica waterfall
Some worker in a beach café give us a ride to his café club devine, real paradise the place where you can swim
We usually don't ask, but it was already late and we walk hitchhiking in the road 40 min until this gas station. We ask some german guys who accept to take us to Bihać.

We got dropped of here on the way to vites. It's a small road but there is quite some traffic. At this spot there is a little place to stop for cars in the southwestern direction it's quite good for hitchhiking. The Bosnian people were once again super welcoming and before we knew it all four of us were in a car with this of duty police man. Great guy he brought us to our end destination.
Very few cars but a man from Kulen Vakuf drove me to his town.

There's a bus stop so it's relatively easy for cars to stop. No shade though. You probably don't need to walk all the way here from the airport, there were earlier spots that might have worked. We wanted to go all the way to Lukomir which worked out in the end. Maybe don't try this when there's a national holiday though.

So, I got dropped right in front of this bridge. I would say that the best tactic here is to cross border on feet and have a sign of where you want to go(In my case it was Beograd) and approach every car, as the line on the border gets pretty long.

In my case no one agreed, so I stood with the sign right after the border control and was feeling desperate because it was already dark, when the guys from the border saved me. They told me they were just hesitating to take me right before the bord
Good spot to go to Prijedor.
Good spot to go to Banja Luka

Had myself dropped off outside of Stolac for easier hitching. There are solid places to hitchhike in both direction along the road, but it's pretty isolated there, so I would only recommend going there when it's still long time till sunset.

Stood here in order to be visible for north cars going out of jajce and the cars coming from the north. There is a small spot for the cars to pullover. However, many cars coming from north are going fast
Good spot to get to Kravica Waterfalls. Drivers have enough space to stop.
Good spot to get to Kravica Waterfall , enough space for drivers to stop
Good spot, lots of traffic.
First we have waited at the gas station, than we have moved infront of the jadran hotel. Lot of space for car to stop, good speed of cars, got a ride to dubrovnik in a decent time
Van picked us up and took us to Jablanica. Asked for money when we arrived but we had no issues when we said no
get out of Martin Brod, not many traffic but easy to find a ride as there is only one road.

There are quite a lot cars but most of them just go home. However they really want to help you. After 20 minutes got ride to Foča with accomodation. We were hitchhiking in latě evening when it was already dark
Not many cars passing by, but we got a ride quickly to Nevesinje
It is not  the best spot bit some people from parking plot saw us and took us a ride
Managed to stop a truck here somehow. Got a cool ride to Prozor but could of got further north is was heading that way
Not the greatest spot, but somehow worked for us after trying different high-rated spots for 5 hours. Got a ride to sarajevo.
Pretty good spot, but there is no shadow

Similar experience as a few before. Good spot but took some time, after 2h and many cars that passed I found a truck directly to Sarajevo. For trucks to stop I recommend standing on the little island before the gas station (and not the parking lot). Friday 8am
A truck stopped, took us to Sarajevo. But noone seemed to care about hitchhikers at all
Caught a lift towards Sarajevo (Konjic) in less then 5 minutes, It was the second car to pass. [Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-from-mostar-to-sarajevo/)
Look good but I didn't catch anything in 2h. Maybe just bad luck, but it seems to me there is a lot of local only traffic.
A really great spot, we a lot of cars going to mostar
I was standing here for about 10 minutes with a sign Mostar, got a ride to Konjic
Good and reachable spot, after some time we got ride to Mostar!
We were lucky, we were walking after giving up at the previous crossroad and one turkish car saw our sign "Mostar" and stopped to take us =)
Really really good spot, we got a ride after 5 minutes. I think we didn't have sign but I am not sure, it was last summer. Direction Višegrad

la sola loko kiu funkciis de ĉiuj 3 markitaj ĉi tie. Nu, la bushaltejon tie mi provis dum la nokto, do ĝi ne gravas tro multe. Sed ĉi tie ne estas tiel facile halti kiel tie. Neniu dubo. Tamen dumtage estas tro multaj homoj haltantaj tie.
Perfect spor. Me and friend(M and , Korean and Croatian) waited lass then 5 minutes.
Waited a bit more than an hour, but maybe because we where trying to get to Beograd it was so long. Got a car till Višograd. Close to the center so perfect place.

Direction: East
We liked this spot for the nice space to pull over, but it took some time to get away (~1.5 h)
No one took us and no shade. We gave up here
road 18 towards Foca. Sign recommended because of the nearby airport.
Good spot if you want to go to Dubrovnik or Montenegro from Mostar, a guy doing Mostar - Dubrovnik took me after 30-40 min
Gave up before nightfall. Plenty of traffic and friendly faces but mainly full family cars & tourists.
Direction Trebinje. Good shade and space for cars to pull over , nice fruit stall nearby.
Good spot to go to Montenegro
I think its a good spot (cars slow down, plenty if space to pull over), but not for the evening. I waited 2h+ but didn't get a ride. Went back to town and someone took me there.

Perfect intersection to cross to catch a ride that crosses to Montenegro. Waited for 50min but got a ride all the way to Herceg Novi. It's worth the wait plus there is plenty of space for a car to pull over.

I don't agree with previous reviews, maybe something changed there.

There's no stop before the tunnel. After tunnel there's a small place for cars to pull over. To signalized, you need to stay on a narrow side of the bridge where it's easy to fall down from very high place. Cars go extremely fast and don't see you at all. It felt impossible and nobody stopped, so I left.
Just 50-100 meters after the tunnel, I got the ride to Belgrade
Another spot if you are not lucky in others before.

Chad estis vere malsana ĉi-tage, kvazaŭ ŝlimo en la tero. Ni provis, sed fakte la automobilo haltis en la superbazaro, verŝajne ankaŭ pro Teamo Schaukel, kiuj en ĉi tiu kazo estis tri kaj ne povis preni tiun rektan veturon, kiu fakte donis al ni la unuan lokon ĉi-tage. Multaj homoj ankoraŭ provis, ĉi tiu ulo fakte iris al Mustar. Bosniano retiriĝis en Francio. 

Alia ĉeĥa petveturanto ricevis veturon antaŭ ni en la sama loko, unu iranta al Tajlando ankaŭ per petveturado.
Took us to Doboj, try our luck there to Sarajevo , little direct traffic
Bus stop here good for car to pull. Many local traffic, waited here an hour then start to keep walking

It took us a long time to leave Mostar (we tried 3 different spots before that one) and still had to wait 45min to get a ride. We hitchhiked on the main road at the entrance of the gas station so people could see us and stop on the lane leading to the gas station.
Maybe got unlucky. Was recommended by previous hitchhikers and locals but no luck for us. Was a lot of local traffic and a lot going to Blagaj if that's what you want.
Long parking space in direction to Mostar. Can be tricky if there are many cars parked and drivers can't see you but it worked for me.

We came here around 13:50, but were hhing with breaks because of rain. Sign Trebinje, but a guy took us all the way to Podgorica, thought of changing sign to Buna. People don't really stop much, maybe because of the season - even with empty cars
To Mostar,
Good spot, especially for a spot inside the city. 2 guys going to Dubrovnik got a ride fairly quickly.

I think it's a very good place. There is a gas station and a traffic light too. We get a lift from here until Pocitelj, but to the seeside also not so hard, or driver went there. We waited here 5 min. 
You can go here on foot, or with bus to, with bus 10. If this place not good, go back to Marsala Tita street and get the bus 6 until the city bord.
Two boys have been waiting for alomost 4 hours. Lot's of tourists cars (full cars with children). We have been here at the end of Juli and we wanted to go to Počitelj.

This spot is not working in 2025 anymore.

I guess they built a highway and nobody uses this road now to go to Serbia. This is only local road with 0 traffic. Avoid.
Very easy spot- waited 5 min, got a ride all the way to Beograd
We waited for 40 min. here then decided to walk up to hill, after the tunnel waited 20 more min then got a ride for 50 km on belgrade direction
Easy enough to walk to.  Good place for cars to pull in.
Good spot just before the tunnel here.  Cars are slow coming up the hill and round the bend.

Ok, so I actually got a ride here to Mostar with three drunk people, but don't really count on getting a ride here. It's a bad spot in overall, and the cars don't often go the whole way. But it's worth a try!
